Detailed Description

This class represents the concept of multilayer perceptron with a hidden layer and an output layer of perceptron neuron models.

See also:
Perceptron.

Definition at line 34 of file MultilayerPerceptron.h.

Definition at line 48 of file MultilayerPerceptron.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::MultilayerPerceptron::MultilayerPerceptron ( int  newNumberOfInputs,
int  newNumberOfHiddenNeurons,
int  newNumberOfOutputs 
)

General constructor. It creates a multilayer perceptron object with one hidden layer and an output layer of neurons. All the free parameters in the neural network are initialized with random values chosen from a normal distribution with mean zero and standard deviation. This constructor also initializes the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Hidden layer activation function: Hyperbolic tangent.
  • Output layer activation function: Linear.
  • Name of input vaviables: "InputVariable0",...
  • Name of output variables: "OutputVariable0",...
  • Units of input vaviables: "None".
  • Units of output variables: "None".
  • Description of input vaviables: "None".
  • Description of output variables: "None".
  • Mean of input variables: 0.
  • Standard deviation of input variables: 1.
  • Mean of output variables: 0.
  • Standard deviation of output variables: 1.
  • Minimum of input variables: -Inf.
  • Maximum of input variables: +Inf.
  • Minimum of output variables: -Inf.
  • Maximum of output variables: +Inf.
  • Lower bound of output variables: -Inf.
  • Upper bound of output variables: +Inf.
  • Number of independent parameters: 0.
  • Pre and post-processing method: None.
  • Numerical epsilon method: Relative.
  • Numerical differentiation method: Central differences.
  • Display out of range warning: False.
  • Display: True.
  • Numerical epsilon: 1.0e-6.

Parameters:
newNumberOfInputs Number of inputs in the neural network.
newNumberOfHiddenNeurons Number of neurons in the hidden layer.
newNumberOfOutputs Number of output neurons in the neural network.

int  newNumberOfOutputs

Definition at line 103 of file MultilayerPerceptron.cpp.

Flood::MultilayerPerceptron::MultilayerPerceptron ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a multilayer perceptron object with zero inputs, zero neurons in the hidden layer and zero output neurons. It also initializes the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Hidden layer activation function: Hyperbolic tangent.
  • Output layer activation function: Linear.
  • Number of independent parameters: 0.
  • Pre and post-processing method: None.
  • Numerical epsilon method: Relative.
  • Numerical differentiation method: Central differences.
  • Display out of range warning: False.
  • Display: True.
  • Numerical epsilon: 1.0e-6.

void Flood::MultilayerPerceptron::setNetworkArchitecture ( int  newNumberOfInputs,
Vector< int >  newNumbersOfHiddenNeurons,
int  newNumberOfOutputs 
)

This method sets the architecture of the neural network. All the free parameters of the neural network are initialized with random values chosen from a normal distribution with mean zero and standard deviation one. It also initializes the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Name of input vaviables: "InputVariable0",...
  • Name of output variables: "OutputVariable0",...
  • Units of input vaviables: "None",...
  • Units of output variables: "None",...
  • Description of input vaviables: "None",...
  • Description of output variables: "None",...
  • Mean of input variables: 0.
  • Standard deviation of input variables: 1.
  • Mean of output variables: 0.
  • Standard deviation of output variables: 1.
  • Minimum of input variables: -Inf.
  • Maximum of input variables: +Inf.
  • Minimum of output variables: -Inf.
  • Maximum of output variables: +Inf.
  • Lower bound of output variables: -Inf.
  • Lower bound of output variables: +Inf.

Parameters:
newNumberOfInputs New number of inputs in the neural network.
newNumbersOfHiddenNeurons New numbers of neurons for the hidden layers of the neural network. The size of this vector is the number of hidden layers.
newNumberOfOutputs New number of output neurons in the neural network.

Definition at line 2495 of file MultilayerPerceptron.cpp.

References descriptionOfInputVariables, descriptionOfOutputVariables, getNumberOfHiddenLayers(), hiddenLayers, hiddenLayersActivationFunction, Flood::Perceptron::HyperbolicTangent, Flood::Perceptron::Linear, lowerBoundOfOutputVariables, maximumOfInputVariables, maximumOfOutputVariables, meanOfInputVariables, meanOfOutputVariables, minimumOfInputVariables, minimumOfOutputVariables, nameOfInputVariables, nameOfOutputVariables, numberOfInputs, numberOfOutputs, numbersOfHiddenNeurons, outputLayer, outputLayerActivationFunction, Flood::Vector< Type >::setSize(), standardDeviationOfInputVariables, standardDeviationOfOutputVariables, unitsOfInputVariables, unitsOfOutputVariables, and upperBoundOfOutputVariables.

void Flood::MultilayerPerceptron::setNumberOfIndependentParameters ( int  newNumberOfIndependentParameters  ) 

This method sets a new number of free parameters independent of the neural network. It initializes the independent parameters with random values chosen from a normal distribution with mean zero and standard deviation one. This method also initializes all the class members related to independent with their default value:

  • Name of independent parameters: "IndependentParameter0", ...
  • Units of independent parameters: "None".
  • Description of independent parameters: "None".
  • Mean of independent parameters: 0.
  • Standard deviation of independent parameters: 1.
  • Minimum of independent parameters: -Inf.
  • Maximum of independent parameters: +Inf.
  • Lower bound of independent parameters: -Inf.
  • Upper bound of independent parameters: +Inf.

Definition at line 4432 of file MultilayerPerceptron.cpp.

References descriptionOfIndependentParameters, independentParameters, initIndependentParametersNormal(), lowerBoundOfIndependentParameters, maximumOfIndependentParameters, meanOfIndependentParameters, minimumOfIndependentParameters, nameOfIndependentParameters, numberOfIndependentParameters, Flood::Vector< Type >::setSize(), standardDeviationOfIndependentParameters, unitsOfIndependentParameters, and upperBoundOfIndependentParameters.

void Flood::MultilayerPerceptron::checkInput ( Vector< double >  input  ) 

This method chechs whether the inputs to the neural network have the right size. If not, it displays an error message and exits the program. It also checks whether the input values are inside the range defined by the minimum and maximum values, and displays a warning message if they are outside.

Matrix< double > Flood::MultilayerPerceptron::calculateJacobian ( Vector< double >  input  ) 

This method returns the the Jacobian Matrix of the neural network for a set of inputs, corresponding to the point in input space at which the Jacobian Matrix is to be found. It uses the back-propagation method.

Parameters:
input Set of inputs to the neural network.
See also:

calculateJacobianTest(Vector<double>).

Todo:
This method is only implemented for multilayer perceptrons with one hidden layer. An extension of this algorithm so as to consider any number of hidden layers must be implemented.
